verb.description: Cause (someone) to find something funny; entertain.
examples: he made faces to amuse her

verb.description: Provide interesting and enjoyable occupation for (someone)
examples: they amused themselves digging through an old encyclopedia
the hotel has planned many activities to amuse its guests

origin: Late 15th century (in the sense delude, deceive): from Old French amuser entertain, deceive, from a- (expressing causal effect) + muser stare stupidly. Current senses date from the mid 17th century.
